question: Barring anymore aggressive embarrassment, I'd like to set a start date for the construction of my chemical plant.
answer: Max Shreck, my friend, you're the pillar of this community. Pillar. There is no citizen whom Gotham values more. No citizen. Your buildings, your stores, your factories, your oil wells, your licorice...

question: Your point?
answer: I've got to refuse permission on the chemical plant construction. Those environmentalists have really been on my back. I just... I'm so sorry, I'll make it up to you, I'll...

question: Please, Mayor, don't drool. Or apologize. I appreciate your honesty. I mean, it is not the first time we have had a disagreement. Golly, actually it is, isn't it?
answer: But I'm sure it's going to be the last time!

question: Thanks for the assistance, Batman. Thanks for doing everything and making us look like idiots. So it's the Red Triangle Circus Gang. Three years ago, their carnival went out of business and...
answer: I know who they are. They've improved.

question: The leaders are in the Shreck building. The Mayor and Max himself are up there. Do you need any...
answer: No.

question: But you can't just...
answer: Yes.

question: We have distinguished guests. Please make them feel at home... Up there, Max, you're the master of Gotham City. Down here, the poodle gets a better parking space. You see, I hear your speeches about protecting the community, then see you dump toxic waste into the sewers. I listen through a sewer grate to you promising one thing, then see you through a ventilator shaft doing another thing. Don't get me wrong. I got nothing against being a two- faced weasel, or even dumping toxic waste -- Stuff works good on rat bites...
answer: Oh really, I didn't....

question: Shut up. It's just, why do you get to be a man of the people and I have to be the boogeyman. It's not fair! You can say I'm jealous. You can say I'm bitter. In ten seconds, you're going to say a lot of things... in a high pitched voice... Wha-a-a-t! Oh....Try the closet in the back of the lair. I....I lost my place?
answer: You were implying that I will be screaming in a high pitched...

question: Yeah, but don't worry, Max, I'm not going to kill you. I'm just going to freeze you for 200 years until they find a cure for rich uppity snob powermongers. I'm only kidding....I'm going to kill you.
answer: You're not going to do anything to me, Penguin.

question: Oh, I'm not? Okay, well, if you put it that way. Jeepers.
answer: Why fight the power, Penguin, when you can become it. You despise the way this city is run. So do I. Tonight, the current Mayor.... disappointed me. I'd like to see more of a... free thinker in his place.

question: Me? The New Mayor? In case you hadn't noticed, I'm a mutant with a bad temper.
answer: You're too hard on yourself. Gotham has no conception of Morality, only Celebrity. This city loves visuals. Look at Batman. Any other city and he would be in an institution or our there doing singing telegrams. Here, he is a hero. You and the Mayor standing at the same podium -- I know where I'm aiming my camera.

question: Me? Mayor? I could walk down the street and no one would laugh at me or throw a big object at me? Or make one of those jokes like, "Did you hear that when Penguin was born, the doctor came out and the Father asked 'Doctor, doctor, is it a boy or a girl?' The doctor says "Guess again." I could get Respect....would I have to give up my hobbies?
answer: Terrorizing innocent people and committing heinous felonies? Not at all. In fact, they'll come in handy.

question: It all sounds divine. Where do I begin?
answer: Anywhere but here. I think you've mature past the Old Zoo hideout/ Lair thing. Let's talk about... ...the new Penguin. The horrifying monster aspect of your personality has been well communicated. My image consultants Punch and Juliet are going to bring out your more Mayoral smile.

question: But he's right...
answer: That, is beside the point. I do not seem to be getting across the whole dual nature thing...

question: Relax... By night, I will cause deviously demented crimes that will put the city into a foaming frenzy. And Batman into a retirement of putting kids on his lap at car shows. By day, I'll cry out to the public that I'm the only brave soul who can come in and stop this wave of deviously demented crimes. In a way, I'll be the most honest politician who ever lived.
answer: By George, I think he's got it. Punch and Juliet, leave an itinerary for tomorrow.

question: Wow, a non-sexual kiss from another male. I feel so hip. And Juliet, you don't think she'd ever, if she was really drunk...
answer: The money is to help with the campaign.

question: I mean, like really blotto...
answer: I'll be giving you a checkbook so you can pay off and keep in line the Red Triangle Circus gang and the rest of the city's scumbags that you use for your crimewave. I want this chaos to be organized ....Mr. Oswald Cobblepot.

question: Oh, Max, buddy, to think I was going to torture and maim you...
answer: I'm sure going to miss that wonderful laugh.

question: Pardonne, Chip...I'm what?
answer: Selina Kyle. Did you happen to see who I was chatting with? You see, it's imperative I not be directly connected with this person.

question: I..didn't..I swear, Mr. Shreck, I didn't see anything. Cross my heart and hope to...Cross my heart.
answer: Put yourself in my position. I'm a very respected man in the community. If you're fibbing about how much you've seen and heard tonight, you could run off and hurt me. You've been a very decent assistant, Selina Kyle, but is this a chance I can take?

question: Yes?
answer: Is your life as important as my reputation?

question: Soon. The Red Triangle Circus Gang were always just cheap thrillseekers. Silly. Easy. Not tonight.
answer: You do not think there is any truth to this dark lord of the gangs, this evil king of the sewers...this Platypus Man, or whatever he is..

question: Penguin.
answer: Surely he is cheap tabloid fabrication created to sell papers to people who can't read...

question: You're not crying.
answer: I'm not crying. And he's not for real.

question: Well, it's certainly the strangest publicity stunt I've ever...
answer: Publicity for what? I don't know who scared me more. Him or the society he so easily makes a fool of. They deserve each other.

question: Should I cancel your meeting with Max Shreck this morning. You seem a bit... Oh look, do you remember...It's from the Christmas just before Ms. Vale decided to leave Gotham City and...
answer: I remember. Merry Christmas, Vicki Vale, wherever the hell you are...

question: No. No glass on the inside.
answer: Interesting. I would offer you coffee, but I am afraid my assistant is using her vacation time. Death in the family.

question: Had some excitement here last night...
answer: You don't know the half of it...My first experience with Batman. Have you ever...

question: No. What did you think of him?
answer: Hell, I thought he was terrific, saved me from a bunch of hyenas with knives on their heads. Little on the quiet loner side. We didn't exactly go out for drinks. I wonder if he works parties... You know I'm doing the masquerade thing again this year. Bring Vicki...

question: We're still not seeing...
answer: Ouch. Vicki was too good for you. You need a woman with those same moody interests you have...

question: Sounds pretty frightening. I'm not coming in on the chemical plant. It's an environmental joke and you know it. Besides, I'm told the Mayor...
answer: The Mayor problem is being dealt with. Bruce, when are you going to drop the high and mighty philanthropist routine...

question: Max, I'm out. We sit on the same boards and panels together, but come on, we're different. You got yourself a cute little kitty as a logo because those creepy market research handlers of yours said it would give you a friendlier public image. But Max, I know you, you're a tough businessman and no offense, not very cute.
answer: ...hold that thought.

question: ...hold that thought.
answer: Maxwell, my man, how's it hanging? I had that crowd in the web of my hand. I bared my soul and they liked it! Whoever said the Truth is the Ultimate Lie wasn't lying ...Is this a bad time, pardner? Oops, sounds like I should of called to say I'd be calling. Blink once for yes, Blink twi--Ha! But seriously, Max I...

question: Well-Max-sorry-to-bother-you-for- the-inconvenience! It-won't- happen-again-real-soon! Sayonara- mon-capitaine! May-your-days-be- filled-with-Bon-Voyagees. Oh now, what's the hurry, "pardner"? I just think we have to keep a low profile on our hostile venture. Did you get my special gift for the employees?
answer: Special gift? That's secret code for the checks, right? Got 'em right here! You're the man! You're the guy! Golly, you must busy as a bee during a visit from the Queen so I'm gonna go...

question: The second phase of the operation begins tonight. The hands-on part. Don't hold back..... Goodbye.
answer: Bye! Wha...oh unfair! Unfair! I missed it!...Oh, I can't believe... My name is not Penguin, it's Oswald Cobblepot! And I like to feel bad! Oh, I missed it! I can't believe...

question: We've met.
answer: We have?

question: Oh. Sorry. I must be mistaking me for someone else.
answer: You mean mistaking me for someone else?

question: That's what I said.
answer: Yeah, but...

question: What happened to your finger?
answer: Let's just say the broken window out there didn't come from Little League practice, Mr. Wayne. I came here to get a file, then bam, next thing I know, I'm making angels in the snow in the alley below. Wow, rhymes. Thing is, I have no memory of who of what pushed me through that window. I mean, it's not complete amnesia. I still remember Dan Schwartz putting 28 cockroaches in my thermos in fifth grade and I still remember getting my first French Kiss from the counselor at the Boy's camp across the swamp, but last night--It's a complete blur. Can't you just die?

question: It's hard to get thrown out of a window, fall--what is it--five stories, and keep your sense of humor.
answer: You sound like you speak from experience.

question: Always. I hope to see you again.
answer: Hope? You can do better than that.

question: You might be right.
answer: Hey guys, now how about a real cup of joe? Double expresso, isn't it?

question: Se-lin-a Kyle.
answer: My God, Bruce, you shouldn't have to see this. Some freak set up a bomb in that Walk/Don't Walk button. How they knew this guy would press it at the exact....

question: This wasn't set up to kill someone specific. It was set up for a good time.
answer: I tell you, these Xmas crimes have no rhyme or reason.

question: Maybe it's just a different kind of poetry. Did you just say Xmas?
answer: Sorry, bad habit. Damn, Wayne, since when did you become such a super-sleuth?

question: Sorry. The idle rich can be a real pain. Too many short stories, hidden word games--How many monkeys can you find in this picture--that kind of thing.
answer: Don't apologize, I'll take all the help I can...

question: Batman! I feel that I know you. Oswald Cobblepot.
answer: Pleasure's all yours. Bargain hunting?

question: Oh, you mean, the Museum. And the alarm. And the general mood of complete chaos. I guess "Penguin must have done it."
answer: Great speech today. How you predicted all this was going to happen...Amazing. You might get a date of it.

question: Tough day at the office?...Quit while you're alive. You're jealous, because your mask isn't real. You hate me because I'm a freak.
answer: You're just another depressing, greedy egomaniac. I don't hate you for being a freak, I hate you for being normal. You're an insult to penguins.

question: Why can't I get mad at you? It must be the pointy ears. But seriously, I'm here as a concerned citizen. Somebody tried to steal this painting. When I made... heard those gunshots, I...
answer: I'm sure your detailed "eyewitness report" will give the boys at the station a good laugh.

question: "...will give the boys at the station.." Look who's pretending to be normal now; A nice "just doing my duty, ma'am" crimefighter. How sad, adorable, and funny, all at the same time. You'll never win that way, Batboy, but then, you know that.
answer: Is that all you have to say for yourself?

question: Meow. Where's the fire, cowboy? Besides Max Shreck's department store. Speak up. I hate a man who's... How could you? I'm a woman...
answer: I'm sorr...

question: As I was saying, I'm a woman...and can't be taken for granted. You are no longer the Night. You're but a puny eclipse, a pitiful reminder of what's supposedly "Right." But in a world of Wrong and Hate. "Irrelevant" is your most notable trait...Are you paying attention, you Batman you?
answer: Hanging on every word.

question: A sense of humor. Surprise tactic. Did you know we live in a society that tells its boys to conquer worlds, but tells its girls not to get their dresses dirty. A man dressed as a bat can be anything, but a woman dressed as anything but a woman is wicked. I'm just living down to my expectations.
answer: People hurt each other, they lie to each other, they're more interested in what I drive, than what I stand for. I need their intelligence, they give me their lunch boxes.

question: Finally, a real conversation and it's not even Valentine's Day. But tell me stud, if you hate society so much, why do you dedicate your life into defending the scum who run it. I'm not here to protect society. I'm here to bring it all down. Life's a bitch, so now am I. My hero. Where were you the last time I died? You don't get it, I don't want to be saved. I want to be changed. Don't worry I still have eight left.
answer: Meow.

question: Morning, Max! Bummer about the store, last night.
answer: Yes, uh...

question: My, those silly exterminators promised me the coffee machine was okey-dokey.
answer: What are you trying...

question: I'm really sorry. Hey, have you seen Chip? He's usually so prompt. We were to have buttered English muffins and hot chocolate together this fine winter's day.
answer: Uh, well, I hope...

question: Yeah-yeah, Mr. Shreck. Consider her spayed. Bye. I'm glad you came. We have so much in common. Death. Destruction. Courage to make a Fashion statement. Overall sexual intensity.
answer: Batman. My friend, we have Batman in common. Our connection is the thorn in both our sides. As long as that smug superhero is around, Gotham City will have some lame sense of security. He's like a God, who works for a living.

question: Honey, this one's on me. The Bat is in a Will-Stop-At-Nothing-To- Bring-Me-To-Justice mode. Figured I'd kill him.
answer: Making a martyr out of Batman is a lot less enjoyable than turning him into what he despises most. Namely, us.

question: What are you doing?
answer: Selina. Hello. I didn't mean to...

question: Hello... Hi, Bruce Wayne. Hi.
answer: It's great to see you in real life, outside the Almighty conference room. I can't believe Ebeneezer Shreck let you out. He must have got a fax from the Ghost of Christmas Future...

question: Something like that. So what are you doing out in the jungle? I thought you quasi-reclusive jillionaire playboy types have robots who come out do your yuletide soap-on-a-rope gift buying.
answer: It's their day off. That was a hell of a sentence. Se-li-na Kyle. There's something about you...I'd really like us to get to know each other. Well, kind of.

question: The news nowadays....It seems to be coming from another planet, another life.
answer: I have a hard time believing it myself, sometimes. "Batman wipes out on Crimewave"? I mean, that's a bit of an exaggeration...

question: You're not going to this thing tonight, are you? "The Relighting of the Tree."
answer: I wouldn't be caught dead here. I have a feeling it's going to be very.....rowdy.

question: Rowdy?.....It's going to be Hell, Bruce, and Chaos and Armageddon and...Uh, at least that's what I think.
answer: Those are big words. I guess we'll just have to watch it on

question: I'm sorry I feel so strongly. And wickedly. I didn't always.
answer: How charming. You got yourself a little dark side.

question: Is it just me today, or do you feel...sane?
answer: It's just you. It's strange, but when I'm with you I forget that the world is... ...like this. I'm sorry. I'm allergic to cats.

question: What do you... To think, I was taught never to get involved with a man with two first names.
answer: you were taught well. My last relationship...forget it.

question: Ah, too late, you started it. What went wrong? Keep things from her?
answer: No, told her everything.

question: Ouch. Well then, let's keep things strictly superficial.
answer: Not yet. First I get a question. Back in the park, where did you learn...

question: Didn't. At least I thought I didn't. I won some karate lessons. Radio thing. I'd been calling for Grateful Dead tix... anyway, I take the course. I was a most serious failure. The instructor kept chanting "Your mind isn't clear, your mind isn't..." It is now...
answer: Why is your body so alive?

question: Uh...Uh-robics. I was very athletic as a girl. It's cute thing for a girl--to be athletic, aggressive....but you grow older, everyone tells you...
answer: Everyone is wrong. Important thing to remember.

question: I'm just so tired. I had incredibly rough night last night.
answer: This city takes a lot out of you. I was running around quite a bit myself.

question: How charming. More of that rugged Last Minute Christmas shopping?
answer: Sure.

question: Bruce, the computer search on the campaign check came through. You were right. It's Max. The money for the Cobblepot Campaign Fund comes from the account of a small Waxed Lips company in the islands. Owned by the Shreck corporation.
answer: Shreck bankrolling Penguin...Damn him. I think we should send Max one of our little gifts.

question: Agreed.
answer: Why didn't you wake me, Alfred. The Re-lighting of the Tree is in a half-hour.

question: I was hoping you would miss it.
answer: You heard Penguin in the Plaza today. He's going to do something. He practically issued an invitation to me.

question: He did issue and invitation. That is what I'm afraid of. The whole thing is...
answer: I know...You didn't put any money on this, did you?

question: And what of your friend?
answer: Oh, Miss Kyle. Her name's Selina Kyle. She's wonderful. Tell her I had some business that came up and I'm really, really, sorry and...and communicate to her that I, I don't know, that I really like her. Not just in a stupid "Be my girlfriend" way. That she makes me feel very.... inside. Very...

question: I will work on it, sir.
answer: Alfred. The butler, I mean, more than a butler. Bruce's told me about you...

question: Hellow, Miss Kyle. Mr. Wayne told me to tell you...
answer: Mr. Wayne. Tell Bruce, some business came up, and...And Alfred, tell him I've been going through a lot of changes and... no, don't tell him that. Just... tell him, he makes me feel like I really actually think I am... Or you know, if you can cook up a sonnet or a dirty limerick or something.

question: Wait...
answer: You're purr-fect; everything I could ever want in a man

question: I also play a mean accordion. A kiss under the mistletoe. Did you know mistletoe is poisonous, if you eat it?
answer: But a kiss is deadlier, if you mean it.

question: How did you know that truck would drive by after you jumped?
answer: I didn't. What about you? Did you mean what you said, Batman, the other night we hung out? About hating society? Or were you just outmaneuvering me? No answer? So much for foreplay. Who are you? Who's the man behind the Bat. Maybe he can help me find the woman behind the Cat. That's not him...here you are...

question: I didn't. What about you? Did you mean what you said, Batman, the other night we hung out? About hating society? Or were you just outmaneuvering me? No answer? So much for foreplay. Who are you? Who's the man behind the Bat. Maybe he can help me find the woman behind the Cat. That's not him...here you are...
answer: Outstanding work. You're Beauty and the Beast in one lusciously wrapped package.

question: Right back at you. Now we do some real damage to the powers-at-be...
answer: You were the real thing, tonight. You're an incredible, creative villain and that's what makes it so hard to do what I have to do. ...That department store you hit last night belonged to Max Shreck.

question: What does that poisonous piece of Upstanding Citizen have to do with anything?
answer: Temp-er. Sorry, you feel so strongly, bu-ut Max Shreck is my bankroll, my boss, and a pretty neat guy all around...

question: My God, you were the one. The one he thought I saw him talking to. That's why he... Corn dog! Corn dog! Corn dog! Max owns the good guys and the bad guys. Even vulgar, twisted little mutants like Penguin!
answer: The name's Oswald Cobblepot, and I don't think I like you anymore. Go to Heaven. I knew I'd have to kill you. It only made me love you more.

question: Restores my faith in inhumanity.
answer: Commissioner Gordon called to warn us that Batman will probably try to attack the elite of the city.

question: What did you tell him?
answer: I told him that since you, in fact, are Batman, that this does not pose a problem.

question: Alfred, you're on a roll.
answer: What is considerably less amusing is that you let this car-hop-street- urchin actually drive...

question: Alfred, I don't want to talk bout it...
answer: You let him see...

question: Alfred. Who let Vicki Vale into the batcave? I'm down there working, I turn around, "Oh hi, Vicki, have a seat..."
answer: I was just so...worried and frightened...the bats...On the T.V., Bix Carbondale getting bonked in the back of the...

question: You should have warned me not to go.
answer: Well, is there at least a way to send the information about the Cobblepot Campaign Fund to Commissioner Gordon?

question: Max can't be treated like a purse snatcher. He's protected by the Mayor. So that's why I anonymously sent a copy of the check and the information directly to our backstabbed Mayor himself. I have no illusions about our Mayor's actual power, but there can't help being some fireworks. Let's see how much Max gets burned. Oh Alfred, did Selina get home okay?
answer: I am sure she got home just fine. She seems like a very nice woman.

question: She is.
answer: I believe I'll take the stairs.

question: Max receive our gift?
answer: Oh yes, and I told him how nice it would look in his conference room.

question: This is all about me not letting you build that stupid chemical plant. All this pain...
answer: It is about a principle. You betrayed me, admittedly slightly, but still, a lesson had to be learned. By plucking a disgusting monster from the sewers and giving him your crown, I hopefully taught one.

question: But if we give you the damn... factory, can you, I mean, will you, stop Penguin and the Crimewave?
answer: Oh, of course. Mayor Cobblepot was a joke I never intended in telling the punchline to. It'll just take a couple phone calls.....But you know, you really haven't apologized.

question: Apolo--! I'm......sorry.
answer: Oh heck, that's okay...don't give it another thought. Tonight's my annual Christmas Eve Max-querade Party at the Club. You should be there. Really.

question: I guess we showed him.
answer: What makes Max Shreck think he can so effortlessly get away with these acts?

question: History....I only wonder how Penguin is going to take the news he's being cut off?
answer: Dear Bruce, Penguin couldn't have possibly thought he was going to be Mayor. I mean, really! You're not laughing.

question: All these years of bataranging two-bit hoods off their tricycles and the real power, the real evil, calmly goes to work in Gotham Plaza and collects "Man of the Year" plaques.
answer: Bruce, this attitude of yours...It makes me...Is it only the memory of your parents that inspires you. It seems like it. You have as much contempt for the people of this city as Max and Penguin combined.

question: You don't understand, Alfred. I do care for the weak, pathetic, and gullible people of Gotham City. Because I'm one of them.
answer: The invitations to Mr. Shreck's loathsome masquerade party came in the mail today. I take it I should R.S.V.P. most vehemently in the negative.

question: Alfred, don't be unmelodramatic. Break out the lampshades, we're going.
answer: May I ask, "What as?"

question: I guess we were right about the Relighting of the Tree. Rowdy.
answer: Thank God, we weren't there.

question: Yeah, schwoof. Nice costume.
answer: Thanks. I guess I'm tired of wearing masks in front of people.

question: I know the feeling. I've done a lot of good things for the community. Ignored a lot of bad things, like my friend and your boss. I'm taking Max down. As Bruce Wayne.
answer: Selina Kyle has always suffered and complained about her problems. I want to be the one to cause problems, so I'm taking Max down, too.

question: Nice name...Oh Robin... You're so small and cuddly and So. Much. Fun. To. Beat.
answer: Oh come on, cut it out. This is so mature....You're not still mad at me for ruining your rep and trashing your car, are you? All I ever wanted was the love of my fellow man and their painful destruction.

question: I understand. I protect the people of Gotham City. From themselves. That means I must love. And despise. I must be the Light. And the Dark.
answer: Oh, stall for time, much....Life is scary. You're a man who wants to be a bat, I'm a freaky bird who wants to be a man. Did you know that I found out tonight that Max Shreck is my brother. Can you believe that? Hey, I wonder what Catwoman's deal was?

question: Actually, she's my girlfriend...
answer: You know, we could talk all night about why we do what we do, why we dress the way we do, who had the best childhood trauma, who got the worst genes, who's the real monster, and what's truly human...But hey, in the end it all comes down to who's holding the umbrella....Any last words?

question: Yes. Just two. Laser Bunny.
answer: I see you brought the whole family I'm sure once you get to know them... I need some famous last words. You gotta give me time for some famous last words...."Death...is like..." "Death is like...."

question: I've heard. Gotham's getting a transplant.
answer: Don't be naive. When people like Max say "Jump", we say "Out the window or off the rollercoaster?" The law does not apply... Please, please...don't make me hurt you. You can't control me.

question: Don't make me fight back. I can't control myself. You've been surrounded by monsters. Now you've become one. Bad move.
answer: Oh, now you tell me...
